title: HRIS Analyst
description:
At GoHealth Urgent Care, we place the needs of our patients first - by providing an effortless patient experience, a welcoming culture of care and seamless integration with market-leading health systems and our communities.  

  

The HRIS Analyst plays a key role in the development, implementation and maintenance of the People Team technology systems associated with the collection, retrieval, accessibility and usage of team member information for GoHealth’s People Team department planning, activities and total rewards. The HRIS Analyst will identify areas of opportunity to improve existing People Team processes, functionality and workflows, and maximize technological capabilities to reduce manual processes (i.e. annual performance review process, onboarding, reporting) and to improve data management and efficiency. Maintains and develops custom reports to meet the requirements of People Team management and staff. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Trains and provides troubleshooting tips to other People Team members on features and functionality of the People Team technology systems and applications as needed. Works with payroll to coordinate retrieval and reporting functions. Audit HRIS feeds against carrier reporting. Serves as HR department liaison to IT function as it pertains to HRIS.

 **JOB REQUIREMENTS**  

  

**Education**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Sciences or business related discipline required

  

**Work Experience**
  

* Minimum 2-4 years’ experience managing various HRIS programs required
* Proficiency with Dayforce, UltiPro, ADP, SAP, Workday or other HRIS and web-based management tools required
* Microsoft Excel super use experience (pivot tables, Vlookup, databases) required
* HR systems reporting, HR process and project management experience required
* Dayforce experience required \\*\\*\\*\\*
* Proven organization skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Exceptional analytical, problem solving and time-management skills
* Demonstrated experience/maturity to handle confidential and sensitive information

  

**Required Licenses/Certifications**  

  

* PHR, SPHR, or sHRBP preferred

  

**Essential Functions**  

* **System Optimization:**
	+ Analyze and report the need for system enhancement or customization
	+ Support the implementation/maintenance of various modules within the HRIS system
	+ Data mapping within the HRIS system and assure data integrity of HR information globally
	+ Primary liaison for HRIS and other HR technology platforms (eg, HR surveys, Learning Management System, ATS system, scheduling system)
	+ Determine the validity of other modules within the HRIS and ensure current modules are being utilized and optimized to the fullest
	+ Recommend changes to current processes to provide more effective use of the HRIS, and take the lead as a project manager to implement these changes (i.e. onboarding and exits, org charts, employment changes, performance management, recruitment, etc.)
	+ Work closely and collaboratively with benefits administration in ensuring open enrollment system functionality meets the needs of the organization and reflects the accuracy of the benefits renewal rates and policy
	+ Responsible for maintaining integrations between all HR systems, including but not limited to: Applicant Tracking (ATS), HR Data (HRIS), and Learning Management (LMS)
	+ Works closely with IT to enhance and maintain system automations throughout People Team Systems
	+ Acts as back-up system admin for ATS and scheduling system functionality
	+ Project manager for new market implementations
* **Analytics:**
	+ Develop and generate ad hoc reports to provide HR with timely and accurate data
	+ Create and maintain documentation of reporting processes and training guides for end users
* **Audits and Compliance**:
	+ Develop a regular monthly audit schedule to review the integrity of data in the HRIS system and databases
	+ Serve as the primary liaison for annual data testing and auditing for HR team and other compliance requirements


Note: this job description is not inclusive of all the duties of the position. You may be asked by leaders to perform other duties. Management reserves the right to revise this position description at any time.

title: Systems Analyst
company: Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Rhode Island
description:
Please email hr\\_business\\_partners@bcbsri.org if you are a candidate seeking a reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process.
  
  

Systems Analyst
  
(multiple positions)
  
  

**Location:** Remote
  
  

**Compensation:**  

* Sr. Systems Analyst - $90,500 - $135,700
* Systems Analyst - $80,100 - $120,200


**Jump into the new world of health insurance:**  

At Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Rhode Island (BCBSRI), our business is healthcare. But our focus is on improving lives. Be part of a team that is large enough to make a difference but small enough to be innovative. Work in a rapidly changing field. Take a chance to be creative. Move outside the status quo. Shape new ideas with the power of a national brand behind you.
  
  

**Join others who know diversity is strength:**  

**We appreciate and celebrate everything that makes us unique:** age, national origin, citizenship status, perspectives, experiences, physical or mental disability, military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression. Our diversity strengthens us as an organization and helps us better serve an increasingly diverse Rhode Island population.
  
  

**Why this job matters:**  

Analyze technical issues and identifies technologies which will produce operational results and add value to the corporation. Conduct business requirements reviews and independently formulate logical statements of business requirements. Formulate and define technical scope to align with business objectives based on both user needs and technology strategy. Develop technical system specifications, resources and processes for sub-systems or system modifications.
  
  

**What you will do:**  

* Conduct business requirements sessions to define technical requirements. Gather technical requirements, ask probing questions, document findings, and incorporate feedback. Translate business needs into technical requirements. Formulate and define technical scope to align with business objectives based on both user needs and technology strategy. Seek input from senior members of the team.
* Analyze and revise existing system logic difficulties.
* Partner with business process experts to learn and understand problems or required changes with software. Develop detailed selection evaluation criteria based on identified IT product requirements.
* Create and/or assist in the creation of technical documentation that describe how systems should be created/modified to meet business requests. Review the designs of vendors who create these types of documents and provide feedback.Map business data elements to backend data sources.
* Participate in functional specification and design reviews, validating technical aspects. Seek input from senior team members.
* Provide innovation to business areas and contribute to improve operational processes by advising in technical expertise.
* Participate in department initiatives and projects.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**What you need to succeed:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and applicable work experience
* Three to five years of systems analysis experience, working on business processes to define technical requirements.
* Experience creating technical documents.
* Understanding of implementation and conversion activities
* API & batch system expertise
* Knowledge of modern web-based application design and client server technology
* Good business acumen and political savvy
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills
* Negotiation skills
* Presentation skills
* Decision-making skills
* Good critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work effectively with a wide variety of people in individual and group settings.
* Ability to work independently.
* Excellent organizational skills and ability to successfully prioritize multiple tasks.
* Ability to manage diverse and deadline-oriented workflow.


**Extras:**  

* Experience with Facets or other healthcare payor adjudication systems.
* Healthcare or insurance experience.
* Experience with Cloud based platform integrations: Azure, Google and Salesforce.
* Experience with waterfall and agile software development methodologies


**Location:**  

BCBSRI is headquartered in downtown Providence, conveniently located near the train station and bus terminal. We actively support associate well-being and work/life balance and offer the following schedules, based on role:
  
* In-office: onsite 5 days per week
* Hybrid: onsite 2-4 days per week
* Remote: onsite 0-1 days per week. Permitted to reside in the following states, pending approval from the Human Resources Department: Arizona, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Massachusetts, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Rhode Island, South Carolina, Texas, Virginia


At Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Rhode Island (BCBSRI), diversity and inclusion are central to our core values and strengthen our ability to meet the challenges of today's healthcare industry. BCBSRI is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information and gender identity or expression.
  
The law requires an employer to post notices describing the Federal laws prohibiting job discrimination based on race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, equal pay, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, and genetic information and gender identity or expression. Please visit https://www.eeoc.gov/employers/eeo-law-poster to view the "EEO is the Law" poster.

title: Business Analyst II
description:
cFocus Software seeks a Business Analyst II to join our program supporting the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Office of the Inspector General. This is a fully remote position. This position requires an active Public Trust clearance and must meet 8570 requirements.  

  

**Qualifications:*** Degree in Computer Science or related field and masters preferred.
* Active Public Trust Clearance
* 8570 Compliant (Security+ CE)
* 5-8 years of experience with ServiceNow, AWS, etc.
* 5-8 years of experience working with Cloud Solutions and PaaS platforms.
* Expertise in, but not limited to, Configuration Management, Strategic Planning, Knowledge Management, Business Analysis, and Technical Analysis.
* 5-8 years of current Business Analyst experience.

  

**Duties:*** Utilizing HHS-OIG’s usage of the ServiceNow platform and needs for Systems Integration.
* There may be work surges to support changing priorities due to new and updated initiatives and additional resources may be needed to assist with these efforts.
* Change to accommodate these changes during the task order’s period of performance.
* Assist the Government with evolving technologies as they are introduced to HHS-OIG.
* Bridge the gap between the Program Manager, Developers, and the Government.
* Lead the analysis, technical planning and requirements gathering phases including initial user request for enhancement or bug fixes, backlog grooming, sprint planning, sprint retrospective, recurring meetings with program offices, as hoc meetings to analyze issues or constraints, or data migration panning.
* Ensure notes are taken for meetings and maintain a library of meeting notes and action items available to the Federal Program Manager.
* Business process and system analysis, design improvement, and implementation efforts and in translating business process needs into technical requirements.
* Change management and training support, including providing organizational and strategic planning for a wide variety of technical and functional requirements.
* Expertise in, but not limited to, Configuration Management, Strategic Planning, Knowledge Management, Business Analysis, and Technical Analysis.

title: HRIS Analyst
description:
Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a passionate and driven team in North America and the Philippines. SunPower provides world-class solar solutions to residential customers across the U.S. with a commitment to a superior customer experience. We welcome forward thinkers, freedom chasers and all those demanding better, cleaner energy to join us. **Summary of Role:**  

Oversees the development, implementation, and maintenance of the company’s policies and procedures related to the administration of Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) to support the long- and short-term business goals of various functions. Delivers automated HR solutions to the business to drive efficiencies and cost savings. Provides HR and leadership with ongoing consultation on processes and tools, which facilitate the administration of quality and timely data. Works with HR to evaluate HRIS software and hardware needs and may design new or modify existing HRIS to meet changing demands.  


### **Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* SuccessFactors/HRIS Focus
* Delivers domain expertise on HR systems based upon functional areas or projects assigned and rives day-to-day operational administration of SuccessFactors and other HR information systems, including configuration, testing, and troubleshooting of issues related to business processes, security, and reporting
* Modules may include Core HCM, Recruiting, Onboarding, Absence Management, Benefits, Talent/Performance, and Compensation
* Develops customer relationships by demonstrating a desire to understand their business processes and challenges while demonstrating a continuous improvement mentality and an ability to execute
* Leads the development of end-user requirements and documentation
* Provides input to change management strategy and deployment from a systems perspective
* Performs configuration builds, testing, and troubleshooting
* Acts as a liaison between our customers and IT or third-party systems vendors
* Identifies and recommends process improvements, system enhancements, and new applications to support business strategies and operational needs
* Assesses current HR Technology trends and new systems release features for incumbent applications.
* Supports audit and compliance efforts, where necessary

  

* Project Management
* Helps to provide a strategic approach to identify, prioritize, and successfully execute a broad portfolio of HR initiatives and projects
* Ensures all HR projects undertaken align with HR’s strategic vision and facilitate HR PMO budget prioritization process and key forums
* Manages all aspects of program execution from scope definition, planning, risk/issue management, status management and communications
* Ensures budget and resources required for HR projects are properly scoped and then monitored and managed via change control
* Anticipates and aggressively removes obstacles that slow down or prevent HR programs from delivering on stated objectives
* Focus on continuous improvement and identify opportunities to make HR PMO processes more efficient and effective
* Prepare executive-level presentations related to programs
* Communicate status of HR initiatives on regular basis to HR leadership and other executives as needed

### **Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field or equivalent, combined experience
* 5+ years’ designing, managing, and administering HRIS platforms
* 3+ Hands on experience working in SuccessFactors modules
* 3+ Project Management experience

### **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Strong exposure and knowledge of various types of HR information systems across the HR function: HCM, LMS, ATS,
* Demonstrated knowledge of HRIS practices and platforms with an ability to provide guidance to leaders and employees through a consultative approach
* Experience presenting to leadership in the company
* Experience working with HR functional roles and serving clients
* Experience with analytics, Excel, PowerPoint and HR Systems
* Experience working in performance-focused environments and administering programs
* Knowledge and experience in HRIS strategies and practices


Please note the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and in the geographical location noted. The base pay for this position ranges from $89,000/year to $167,200/year. Pay is based on several factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Dependent on the position offered, other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package including annual bonus eligibility, short and long-term incentives, and a comprehensive and competitive benefits program which includes health insurance coverage, employee wellness, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays, paid time off, and so much more.For more information, please visit our benefits site athttps://us.sunpower.com/employees-benefits.  

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and underrepresented minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At SunPower, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. **Equal Employment Opportunity**
The Company is an equal employment opportunity employer and makes employment decisions, including but not limited to, hiring, firing, promotion, demotion, training, and/or compensation, on the basis of merit. Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration. The Company’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions, the actual sex of the individual, or the gender identity or gender expression), race, color, religion, including religious dress practices and religious grooming practices, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran or military status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, ordinances, or regulations. The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company, including supervisors and co-workers.  

EOE Minorities/All Genders/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Business Systems Administrator
description:
Do you love building new systems in a fast-paced, high-impact work environment? Are you driven to change the standard of care in women’s health?  

  

The Lactation Network is hiring a **Business Systems Administrator.** This person will be essential in the administration and maintenance of IT systems.  

  

We are a small, tight-knit, purpose-driven organization with aggressive growth goals in 2024 and beyond. We don’t have all the answers and we don’t expect you to, either. We do expect you to be curious, hardworking, and striving to be your best self.  

  

**Breakdown of the role*** **Systems Administration & Maintenance (40%).** Your primary responsibilities will be to configure system settings, conduct regular system maintenance and perform user management.
* **Business Analysis (30%).** This position will collaborate with business stakeholders to document business process and requirements.
* **Analytics & Reporting (30%).** You’ll configure and manage revenue cycle data dashboards, data exports and data reports.


  

**What you’ll do**  

Reporting to the Technical Lead, you will have responsibilities that include:* Serve as primary administrator for our various Healthcare revenue cycle systems.
* Configure systems to meet needs of business processes and customers.
* Audit user access to systems and ensure licenses are being used effectively.
* Perform routine maintenance and controlled updates to IT systems.
* Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to collect and document requirements and clarify business objectives.
* Create system documentation e.g. data flow diagrams, standard operating procedures, etc. Thoroughly test and deploy configuration updates to revenue cycle systems.
* Coordinate and assist with User Acceptance Testing.
* Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge bases.


  

**What we expect from you*** 3-5 years of experience as a Systems Administrator or similar role.
* 2+ years of experience with common enterprise system cloud-based platforms e.g., ERP, CRM, EMR, CMS, Netsuite
* Experience with relational databases, queries and extracts e.g. SQL
* Experience with data analysis, data visualization and dashboards.
* Experience gathering and documenting user requirements.
* A growth mindset
* A bias for action
* Close attention to detail
* Strong collaboration and communication skills
* High EQ
* The ability to inspire
* Poise under pressure
* A glass-half-full attitude

  

**What we’d also love to see*** Experience in high-growth organizations
* Health insurance billing and revenue cycle experience
* A Chicagoland home address (but we’ll consider remote candidates, too)
  

  

**What you can expect from us*** **Unlimited PTO.** We work hard. We’re passionate about what we’re building together. We also have lives outside work.
* **Healthcare benefits.** Medical plus voluntary vision, dental. (We are a healthcare company, after all.)
* **401(k) with 4% employer match.** We’re planning for the future—and we want to help you do the same.
* **Remote-first culture.** We are a distributed, remote-first team. We also like spending time together in our Chicago office and have a flexible in-office culture for those who wish to return to work in-person.
* **Mindfulness and Meditation App.** You’ll have complimentary access to the leading app for meditations, sleep stories, and other wellness resources.
* **Recharge.** We have one designated “no meeting day” each week so you can take a break from videoconferencing and have some quiet time to focus.
* **Professional development.** We invest in our team by offering every employee access to a professional development budget.
* **Competitive compensation.** We’re looking for top talent.
* **A growth environment.** The sky’s the limit.

  

**About Lactation Network**  

The Lactation Network is setting a new standard for parents and lactation consultants alike. At TLN, our movement goes beyond any single outlet or tool. We activate education, connection, and advocacy to foster the new network of inclusive care between parents and IBCLCs; the network where every caregiver has the resources to thrive. TLN is powered by the largest network of IBCLCs in the country. Together, we are here to make sure families get the expert insurance covered lactation care that they deserve.  

  

The Lactation Network is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Programmer Analyst
company: BMD, Inc. and Family of Companies
description:
**Programmer Analyst – BMD Mfg.**

BMD, Inc. is a forward-thinking window, door, and building materials manufacturer and distribution company committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology to drive innovation and efficiency. We are currently seeking a talented and motivated Programmer Analyst to join our dynamic IT team. This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development, implementation, and maintenance of software solutions that play a crucial role in achieving our business objectives.

**Why Choose BMD?**

At BMD, we believe in fostering a vibrant and rewarding work environment and company culture where you’ll experience:

* A great company with a solid reputation throughout our 80-year history.
* Employee ownership culture guided by our Pillars of Success and mission & values.
* Opportunity to have a positive impact on our processes and the experience of our employee-owners.
* Competitive salary and benefits package. 401(k) with a company match, and Employee Stock Ownership Plans (ESOP).
* Total Reward Package also includes incentive plan, medical, dental, vision, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, employee assistance program, and more!

**Position Overview:**

As a Programmer Analyst specializing in Manufacturing, you will play a pivotal role in optimizing our technological infrastructure to enhance efficiency and innovation in our manufacturing processes. If you have a strong programming background, coupled with a deep understanding of manufacturing workflows, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the future of our production capabilities.

**Responsibilities:**

* **System and Business Analysis:**
* Collaborate with business end-users to understand system requirements.
* Conduct detailed analysis of user needs, document requirements, and propose solutions.
* Support domestic and international manufacturing business operations in BMD-Q, our world-class Configure – Price – Quote (CPQ) solution.
* **Software Development:**
* Write, test, and maintain code for various software applications with a manufacturing focus..
* Design, develop, and implement software solutions based on specifications.
* **Database Management:**
* Design, implement, and maintain databases to support application development.
* Ensure data integrity and security within databases.
* **Troubleshooting and Debugging:**
* Identify and resolve software-related issues and bugs.
* Perform debugging and testing of applications.
* **Documentation:**
* Create and maintain technical documentation for code, databases, and software applications.
* Document coding procedures and best practices.
* **Collaboration:**
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including business leads, project managers, and other developers.
* Provide technical support and guidance to team members.
* **Quality Assurance:**
* Conduct unit testing and integration testing to ensure software meets quality standards.
* Collaborate in the development and execution of test plans.
* **Stay Updated:**
* Keep abreast of industry trends, new technologies, and best practices in software development.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* **Technical Skills:**
* Proficiency in programming languages (e.g., ASP. Net, Java, C++, Python).
* Experience with database management systems (e.g., MS SQL Server, Oracle).
* Knowledge of software development methodologies and cross platform systems integration.
* **Analytical Skills:**
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* **Communication:**
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with non-technical stakeholders.
* **Team Player:**
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* **Attention to Detail:**
* Thoroughness and attention to detail in coding and system analysis.
* **Adaptability:**
* Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements and priorities.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Please provide your direct email address and a current phone number.

Work Location: Remote

title: Expert Systems Analyst - Remote
company: Altera Digital Health Inc. United States
description:
Altera, a new member of the N. Harris Computer Corporation family, delivers health IT solutions that support caregivers around the world. These include the Sunrise™, Paragon®, Altera TouchWorks®, Altera Opal, STAR™, HealthQuest™ and dbMotion™ solutions. At the intersection of technology and the human experience, Altera Digital Health is driving a new era of healthcare, in which innovation and expertise can elevate care delivery and inspire healthier communities across the globe. A new age in healthcare technology has just begun.

**Overview**



The position is responsible for enhancing, maintaining, and reporting on the Hosting business clients as it pertains to their revenue production, expenses in people and material, and overall profitability. To act as the subject matter expert for the creation of documentation, processes, and procedures and to facilitate an ongoing training program to assure the Hosting business unit and its Finance partners are informed on the latest developments to the program. Provide direct support to the Hosting Technical Account Managers in using the provided information to best serve their clients in the most cost-efficient manner.

  


**This is a remote role in the US.**

  


**Responsibilities**


* Communicates effectively with all parties related to assigned process area.
* Interacts with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts, internal and external, to understand their problems and use cases to create new business requirements and enhancement requests.
* Work independently and with mentors/peers to gather and translate business requirements into business specifications and apply them to enhance existing business processes or to create new ones.
* Provides formal training to team members and documentation as needed.
* Coordinates cost efficiency initiatives across the Hosting business unit operational and business teams to ensure business goals are met without impacting client satisfaction.
* Perform cyclical systematic client level audits with the Technology Account Managers to drive cost efficiency and curtail impacts on profitability.
* Formulates and drives compliance with business control policies and processes.
* Maintains business documentation based on standard operating procedures in support of the assigned business practices.
* Reviews operational documentation periodically for accuracy and effectiveness.
* Maintain data inputs for client profitability reporting and dashboards.
* Maintain data loads and operational performance for client profitability dashboards.
* Formulate, document and monitor client profitability KPI metrics.
* Execute any monthly charge back and/or business unit cost allocation process for P&L posting.
* Provide recommendations for reporting and dashboard enhancements.
* Collaborate with internal teams and external business units for cost optimization opportunities.
* Collaborate with finance and Technology Account Managers to develop budgets, forecasts, and financial plans. Monitor and report on budget performance, variances, and trends.

  


**Qualifications**



Academic and Professional Qualifications:


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent/years of experience required.

  



Experience:


* 7+ years relevant work experience; 2-3 years at the Senior level or equivalent experience.
* Experience in business analysis and documentation.
* Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills.
* Self-driven with ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.
* Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.
* Problem solver, detailed oriented and strong analytical skills, especially dealing with large volumes of data.
* Accountable with strong desire and determination to resolve complex issues with the ability to prioritize and recognize the impact on the business unit.
* Solid analytical, research, and time-management skills with great attention to detail.
* Excellent verbal and written skills interacting with various technical and financial support teams and business units within Altera Digital Health.

  



Travel Requirements:


* May require other travel for business needs.

  



Working Arrangements:


* Standard work week or as defined by assignment requirements.

title: Business Analyst, Clinical Services-Remote
description:
**Putting People First in Pharmacy-** Navitus was founded as an alternative to traditional pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) models. We are committed to removing cost from the drug supply chain to make medications more affordable for the people who need them. At Navitus, our team members work in an environment that celebrates diversity, fosters creativity and encourages growth. We welcome new ideas and share a passion for excellent service to our customers and each other.


We are unable to offer remote work to residents of Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Dakota, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming.


The **Business Analyst, Clinical Services** will manage and coordinate the development of program and product requirements within the Clinical Services Division. Working with various products, this role will be a subject matter expert on the process to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs for various projects. This role will help the team submit projects, test, and implement changes. This role will also play a role in process improvement, assisting others in strategizing and documenting needs to support operational efficiencies.


Is this you? Find out more below!

**How do I make an impact on my team?**

* Document and validate business requirements, use cases, and stories for use in small and large projects as well as process improvement efforts.
* Analyze and verify requirements/user stories for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
* Collaborate with Program Managers and Product Managers to ensure project goals are being met and functionality works as intended.
* Assist in the development and maintenance of project financials and ROI.
* Create and execute test plans to ensure system enhancement meets the deliverables.
* Manage issue/defect requests and resolution.
* Communicate to the training leads to ensure that enhancements are reflected in the internal and external training materials.
* Learn and apply technical tools that support the product development process and are used to communicate the business features to the technical design and development teams.
* With input from key stakeholders, prioritize the business needs of the product and incorporate the criteria to develop the product’s functional releases.
* Create and update status reports upon request that communicate the status/health of products in development.

**What our team expects from you?**

* A minimum of a bachelor's degree or a combination of experience and a relevant certification from recognized industry organizations.
* Minimum of four years experience with some of the following functions:
	+ Documenting complex technical processing functions.
	+ Participating in an agile development project team.
	+ Experience with core software applications, including Microsoft Word and Excel.
	+ Experience in roles like a Business Analyst, Business Systems Analyst, or Product Manager.
	+ Experience with Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint, Project, and Team Foundation Server.
	+ Working experience with pharmacy benefits and claims processing.
	+ Experience validating/testing project deliverables.
* Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives
* The ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employees

**What can you expect from Navitus?**

* Hours/Location: Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm, CST-Remote
* Paid Volunteer Hours
* Educational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistance
* Referral Bonus Program – up to $750!
* Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Nine paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program

**#LI-Remote**

title: Lead Systems Analyst only W2
description:
**Job Description**

**General Information:**

* Most of our projects are in the backend data warehouse environment. Data pipeline, data analysis / profiling and strong SQL skills are essential. Data modeling, ETL, data governance knowledge / experience is great. Along with several soft skills necessary to succeed in such as communication (verbal / written), vendor management, initiative, flexibility, etc.
* A typical Business Analyst or front-end person is not what we are looking for. However, they can have some of those skillsets / experience.
* A technical business analyst or data analyst, data engineer perhaps..
* Definitely more technical but must be able to communicate with all levels and areas and translate business requirements into the functional and technical requirements.

**Non-Negotiables:**

1) Experience with databases and SQL (Prefer DB2); ETL exposure (preferably AbInitio); Reporting system exposure (preferably Cognos)  
2) Data Modeling, Data analysis, data profiling and data manipulation skills.  
3) Experience with implementing ETL systems and reporting systems / data warehouses and data marts  
4) Experience in exploring and writing functional requirements with business/tech teams. Example documents: Functional Requirements Specifications (FRS), Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), Source to Targets (S2Ts), Data Exchange Documents (DEDs), and Data Models.  
5) Good communication skills - written and spoken.

**Required Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum 7 years of IT work experience including application system design and implementation.
* Experience with the following technology stack: Cognos, Tableau, XML, SQL, Ab-Initio, DB2, Oracle
* Knowledge of multiple development methodologies.
* Experience with the following: Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data Marts, Data profiling, Data Quality analysis and Data Analytics.
* Advanced SQL query and experience in a data analyst role with strong data analysis and analytical skills
* Minimum 3 years of database modeling including one or more of the following: DB2, Oracle, SQL/Server or comparable
* Effective at gathering and analyzing business requirements and current system behavior and collaborating to create system design specification documents including functional specifications, system use cases, mock-ups, and design models.
* Demonstrated experience working within a complex team environment, working with multiple vendor teams, providing SME support across multiple programs
* Experience with reference data management / governance and end to end data lineage
* Proven ability to lead a team and collaborate with stakeholders
* Strong collaboration, facilitation, and listening skillset

**Preferred Basic Qualifications:**

* Masters Degree.
* Strong technology project management skills.
* Healthcare data experience.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication
* Customer Internal and External consulting experience
* Knowledge about HEDIS, Care and Disease management programs, Stays, Groupers
* Preferred experience with Ab Initio products like MDH, Query>It, data profiler
* Exposure to job scheduling systems is a plus
* IBM Watson Health Advantage Suite experience is a bonus
* Contingent will be assigned to multiple projects within the FEP Program.
* Contingent will be responsible for completing all the System Analysis & Design work and deliverables for all assigned projects.

title: Computer Systems Analyst
description:
Overview:
**TISTA Science and Technology Corporation**, a CMMI Maturity Level 3 company, focuses on delivering information technology and professional services to Federal and State agencies. TISTA is recognized in 2019 by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing private companies in the US. TISTA is also a recipient of 2019 Top Veteran-Owned Companies by the Washington Business Journal. TISTA also received a 2018 Moxie Award in the GovCon category.  

Are you a **Computer Systems Analyst** who would like to have a positive impact for thousands of people? If so, we may have an opportunity for you!

 **TISTA** associates enjoy above Industry Healthcare Benefits, Remote Working Options, Paid Time Off, Training/Certification opportunities, Healthcare Savings Account & Flexible Savings Account, Paid Life Insurance, Short-term & Long-term Disability, 401K Match, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Paid Holidays, Military Leave, and much more!


Responsibilities:
* Research emerging technologies to consider implementation and how they could increase the effectiveness and efficiency of the organization
* Consult with managers to determine the IT system’s role within an organization
* Collaborate with personnel and management staff to clarify, prioritize and design alternatives
* Work in collaboration with technical writers, systems designers, and systems architects
* Assist with creating high-level designs based on the technical and functional specifications
* Assist with mapping business requirements to functional specification.
* Prepare cost benefit analysis to help management determine if IT systems and upgrades to existing computing infrastructure are feasible
* Devise ways to introduce new functionality to current computer systems
* Design and implement new systems by selecting and configuring software and hardware
* Oversee the installation and configuring of new systems, customizing them for the organization
* Monitor computer system performance, and resolve any problems post-implementation
* Test systems to ensure they work as expected
* Assist with training system’s end users and writing instructional manuals


Qualifications:
* Creativity to find innovative solutions to computer issues when necessary
* Experience using various techniques to design computer systems such as data-modeling to create rules for the computer to present data
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex issues in ways that both the technical and business side of operations can understand
* Strong documentation skills
* Strong organizational, collaboration and prioritization skills
* Analytical skills for interpreting complex information received from several sources, deciding the best way to move forward and anticipating the effect of the changes
* In-depth understanding of how IT processes and components work
* Ability to self-educate working with certain types of computer systems
* Familiarity with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) using the Agile methodology
* Experience working individually and with teams to develop solutions
* Understanding of change management

**Education:*** Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Systems, Business, or related scientific /technical discipline plus 2+ years’ experience

**Clearance:*** Ability to obtain Moderate Background Investigation (MBI) clearance

 **Location:*** Remote

**Salary Information:**

* The pay for this position ranges from $74,750 to $90,000.
* The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
* Also, certain positions are eligible for additional forms of compensation, such as bonuses.
* TISTA associates are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits plan! More information can be found here: https://tistatech.com/working-at-tista/

title: Senior Business Analyst (Remote)
description:
You've stumbled upon the rare B Corp government contractor! At TCG, we aim to prove that businesses can be good to their employees and responsible to their community, all while being profitable. We're an award-winning IT solutions provider to the Federal government seeking a **Senior Business Analyst** to join our team.


US Citizenship and the ability to pass a Federal government clearance check are required.


TCG is pleased to offer remote employment in the following states: AL, AZ, CO, CT, DE, GA, HI, IL, IN, KS, LA, MD, MA, MI, MN, MO, NJ, NC, OH, OR, PA (excluding the City of Philadelphia), SC, TN, UT, VA, WV, and WI.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Elicit and document business and system requirements, making recommendations for business process improvements
* Collaborate with the Program Manager and technical staff, including senior architects, to design and estimate system requirements and development
* Participate in and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with end users
* Develop user stories with acceptance criteria
* Lead and mentor other business analysts
* Coordinate user acceptance testing activities with agency business users
* Create test plans, test cases, and test scripts and perform functional testing of the system
* Ensure that every phase and feature of the software solution is tested and that any potential issue is identified and fixed before the product goes live
* Support users with application training and technical support


REQUIRED SKILLS:

* A minimum of 7 years of experience working as a Business Analyst in an Agile Scrum environment
* A minimum of 3 years performing unit, integration, system, and regression software testing
* Proven ability to act as a liaison between analysts, developers, clients, and other stakeholders during all phases of development
* Proven ability to facilitate effective customer requirements-gathering sessions
* Proven ability to facilitate effective customer-user acceptance testing
* Comfort collaborating with developers and other analysts to define system needs
* Demonstrated ability to learn and contribute quickly to project requirements
* Experience developing test plans, test cases, and test scripts
* Experience documenting requirements in User Story format with clear Acceptance Criteria
* Experience facilitating customer requirements-gathering sessions and user acceptance testing (UAT)
* Experience working as a member of an Agile/Scrum software development team
* Experience working with databases, SQL, and Web-based applications
* Experience working with iterative systems development life-cycle and documentation
* Possess independent problem-solving skills, strong analytical abilities, creativity, and a customer service-oriented personality
* Initiative and the ability to work with minimal supervision
* Understanding of the basic principles of system analysis and quality assurance
* Attention to detail
* Clear and concise communication, writing, and presentation skills
* US citizenship and the ability to pass a Federal government clearance


PREFERRED SKILLS:

* Certified Scrum Master (CSM)
* Experience with relevant CMMI Level 2 & 3 processes (Requirements Development and Management, Configuration Management, Change Management, Technical Solution)
* Requirements traceability matrix (RTM) development and management


EDUCATION:

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline; four (4) years of experience may be substituted instead of a degree


Proof of COVID-19 vaccination is a job requirement. Reasonable accommodations may be available for those not vaccinated due to health reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs.


TCG does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, caste, or veteran status.


Our B Corp mission is reflected in our benefits, including offerings like health care, 401K, parental leave, adoption assistance, financial planning services, student loan repayment assistance, and training budget. There's more, see for yourself.


TCG is recognized for treating employees well, in fact, in 2022 The Washington Post named TCG as a "Top Workplace" for the 8th straight year, and Fortune magazine named TCG on their best workplace lists for the sixth year in a row, based on how our employees feel about the company, the benefits TCG offers, and the work/life balance that our staff are able to achieve. And our CEO was ranked best, by virtue of TCG employees' votes, among all midsize companies in the Washington Post Top Workplace survey.


Try us ... we'll make you happy.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Business Systems Analyst || Remote || Contract**

***Healthcare experience preferred***

***Robotics process automation preferred***  
***Interview process consist of reviewing of the resume and teams video interview with other team members***

**Technical Support/Business Expertise**

* Provide technical knowledge and support in operational system/application and procedural issues to the business and IT and help the business find technical solutions to meet their goals.
* Work in some phases of systems analysis and consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
* Provide ongoing user support for ad hoc questions, inquiries, and service requests.
* Provide timely and accurate reporting/data on inventory, productivity, user activity, and system performance on a regular and/or as requested basis.

**Issue Resolution**

* Resolve medium, moderately complex production issues by:
* Performing initial triage for severity and business impact of system/application failures.
* Troubleshooting and analyzing to determine root cause of issues
* Developing applicable **business processes and solutions to ensure quality, cost effectiveness, timeliness of customer service, and regulatory requirements and mandates are met.**
* **Coordinating with IT, other teams and vendors as needed to communicate issues and devise and implement long term remedies.**
* Develop system support processes with IT; coordinate daily to resolve production support issues, including application failures and user errors; document, track and report all system support activities

**Project/Program Support**

* Work collaboratively on projects and initiatives with the business and IT by eliciting and documenting business requirements and preparing appropriate functional specifications while considering technical capabilities of the system/application.

**System Configuration**

* Configure and maintain moderately critical system tables and data elements across multiple system environments
* Analyze, develop and implement configuration changes to improve system performance and user efficiency
* Monitor configuration for accuracy and compliance to change control processes.

**Hiring Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
* 3+ years of experience in related field.
* In lieu of degree, 5+ years of experience in related field.

title: GMS Systems Analyst- #297
description:
* **~2 Year Contract- Possible Extensions**
* **W2 Employee Only- NO CORP to CORP**
* **Candidate can work 100% remote from the U.S., however Texas Residency is preferred, due to monthly onsite team meetings**
* **Starting range $65+/hr, depending on experience level**

﻿

﻿

JOB DESCRIPTION

**GMS Systems Analyst (II/III/Senior/Lead)**

JOB SUMMARY

Provides technical support and performs system administration and maintenance activities to support the Energy Management System (EMS) and its ancillary systems and applications. Participates in planning and evaluating the impact of system modifications and maintenance activities to ERCOT grid operations. Maximizes EMS uptime and mitigates system failures. Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve EMS. This position will report to the Supervisor of Grid & Market Solutions (GMS) Systems Support Team.

﻿

JOB DUTIES

* Primarily responsible for support, system administration, and maintenance of the EMS upgrade systems through the various testing cycles.
* Responsible for the integration of various EMS applications, monitoring, and regular maintenance.
* Performs various kinds of structured/unstructured testing and logs defects in the defect tracking tool.
* Works closely with the business lead, project manager and technical lead by providing timely updates and feedback.
* Works closely with the EMS vendor and ERCOT GMS development teams to reproduce defects and test the fixes.
* Works closely with the GMS Applications Engineering teams to get the defect fixes, releases installed across various testing environments.

﻿

ADDITIONAL JOB DUTIES MAY INCLUDE

* Routinely monitors EMS systems and applications, as well as regular maintenance activities
* Coordinates and performs Database updates and upgrades in the EMS environments
* Assist Operations Engineer, Market Operations, and other business units during EMS acceptance testing of new and/or enhanced applications
* Supports effective EMS use and administration by preparing and reviewing technical documentation
* Performs code build, patch implementation and migrations in the EMS systems
* Performs system setup and testing with Market Participants as appropriate
* Responds to system failures and operator questions on a 24/7 basis
* Works with market participants to resolve problems and implement changes
* Performs emergency recovery and troubleshooting of EMS system and applications
* Maintains real-time data collection to support EMS functions
* Maintains, troubleshoots, and repairs the EMS systems, applications, and interfaces
* Proactively identifies design problems and drives resolution
* Participates in EMS Disaster Recovery Drills
* Tests, certifies, and implements changes to the EMS Production and Test
* Performs systems maintenance and improvement activities to support the effectiveness of the EMS
* Participates in planning and evaluating the impact of system modifications and maintenance activities

﻿

EXPERIENCE

* 5+ years of work experience in system administration on Linux/Windows Operating systems and working experience with RDBMS (Oracle/SQL DB)
* Preferred system administration experience in GE EMS Suite. If not, other EMS vendor experience such as Hitachi/ABB, Siemens, OSI, GE PowerOn Reliance.
* Experience with Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA)/Inter Control-Center Communication Protocol (ICCP)

﻿

EDUCATION

* Bachelor's Degree: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field (Required)
* Master's Degree: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field (Preferred)
* or a combination of education and experience that provides equivalent knowledge to a major in such fields is required

title: Sr. HR Systems Analyst
description:
**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Serve as a liaison between HR, IT, and the business user community
* Partner primarily with the leaders of the talent and organizational development functions to ensure HR technology needs are met
* Provide timely and comprehensive system support to employees, managers, and HR team members
* Assist with technical and process-related issues related to HR systems by investigating problems and developing detailed suggestions for resolution
* Maintain documentation of process workflows and change controls
* Maintain complex, role-based system security profiles
* Assist in the creation of data analytics
* Provide project leadership and support from design through implementation
* Identify, track, monitor, and communicate project-related issues, scope changes, variances, and contingencies that occur during projects
* Perform testing responsibilities, including reviewing specifications, creating test scenarios, and overseeing testing of the system
* Evaluate and recommend potential system enhancements and upgrades
* Assist in training end users of HR systems
* Support various system upgrades, patches, and other projects as assigned

Requirements:
***Education and Experience***


* Undergraduate degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, Human Resource Management or a related field (work experience may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis)
* 5 to 8 years of progressive experience in HR systems
* Minimum two years of administering HR systems focused on learning, performance, compensation, and/or succession management
* Extensive working knowledge of general business and HR practices with strong understanding of Human Resources programs, processes and data
* Certification and/or License – Professional Certification highly preferred (HRIP, PHR, SPHR, PMP, etc.)


***Necessary Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities***


* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
* Solid teamwork and interpersonal skills, ability to quickly develop and maintain collaborative working relationships
* Well-developed organizational and time management skills; attention to detail
* Ability to exercise independent judgment and creative problem-solving techniques
* Ability to create and maintain system operating procedures in both technical and user-friendly language
* Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, strong working knowledge of Teams

title: Business Analyst - IT
description:
SDA Solutions LLC is looking for a motivated IT Business Analyst for a full-time remote role in support of a Federal client in Washington, DC. The position is long-term and contingent upon contract award.

**The business analyst shall be responsible for analyzing the organization or business domain of OTS programs and initiatives and documents its business processes or systems, by assessing the business model and its integration with technology.**

**The Business Analyst shall act as a liaison among stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies, and operations of OTS, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Analyst to join our team. As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity. Your expertise in data analysis, project management, and analytics will be crucial in driving strategic decision-making and achieving business objectives.

**Responsibilities**

-System analysis experience and the ability to analyze and document business and system processes.  
-Meeting coordination, facilitation, and documentation.  
-Experience in quality improvement and Integration and Testing of new solutions.  
-Experience or training in project management, gathering, validating, and documenting various system, information, or business needs.

The Business Analyst may also support the development of training material, participate in the implementation, and provide post implementation support. This may involve the development of project plans and requires project management skills.

Qualifications  
- Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field  
- Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role  
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy  
- Ability to analyze complex problems and provide innovative solutions  
- Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines  
- Excellent communication skills with the ability to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

If you are a proactive problem-solver with a passion for data analysis and driving business growth, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and contribute to the success of our organization.

Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted for further consideration.

title: Senior Analyst, Business Systems - Remote
description:
Senior Analyst, Business Systems

**Who we are:**


At Lifepoint Health, we provide quality healthcare to rural communities. As a valued member of our team, you will be an integral part of a group working together to elevate Lifepoint's healthcare delivery network. Our network includes 60+ community hospitals, 60+ rehabilitation/behavioral health hospitals, and 250 additional sites of care across the United States. As an organization, we are dedicated to serving communities nationwide by providing exceptional care. We believe in the power of our talented teams and strive to create environments where employees find purpose and fulfillment.

**What you’ll do:**


As a **Senior Analyst, Business Systems** at Lifepoint Health, you will support Health Information Management (HIM) departments by implementing information systems and serving as a liaison between facility HIM departments and IS for software issues. You will provide expertise in Oracle/Cerner Electronic Health Records (EHR) and coding operations, identifying opportunities for business process improvements. Operating under minimal supervision, you will resolve problems under critical time constraints, ensuring alignment with LifePoint Health standards and policies.

**Responsibilities:**

* Analyze HIM requirements, utilization, and trends across Lifepoint markets to drive adoption and reduce costs.
* Coordinate application changes, including maintenance/patches and software changes.
* Resolve break/fix issues and address clinical EHR needs with customers.
* Plan, deploy, and remediate technology initiatives and patient outcomes with HIM directors and stakeholders.
* Serve as SME for HIM workflows, improvements, and solutions deployments, integrating operational technology.
* Manage Cerner solutions HIM requirements and workflows, including Legal Health Record and coding.
* Support quality initiatives and recommend system solutions for improved patient outcomes.

 **What you’ll need:**

**Education:** Bachelor’s Degree or any equivalent experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities; radiology, nursing, or other healthcare background preferred.  

  

**Experience**: 5 years in clinical setting support HIM requirements and workflows including Legal Health Record, Release of Information (ROI), physician deficiencies, state reporting, user access auditing, data retention, and coding and reimbursement, at least 3 years’ experience in Cerner build and systems implementations; experience with AccessHIM a plus

**Why choose us:**

As a team member of the Health Support Center, our goal is to support those that are in our facilities who are interfacing and providing care to our patients and community members. Our focus is to attract, retain, and empower a diverse and determined workforce. Our mission statement is at the heart of who we are and what we do: “Making Communities Healthier.” In this shared mission, we believe that our collective efforts will shape a healthier future for the communities we serve.

**Benefits:** We offer an excellent total compensation package, including a competitive salary and benefits. Some of our benefits include 401k, flexible PTO, generous Employee illness benefit (EIB), medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, and an Employee Assistance Program. We believe that happy, healthy people have a passionate engagement with life and work and have designed our package to enhance your wellbeing.

 **Equal opportunity and affirmative action employers and are looking for diversity in candidates for employment: Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran**

title: Systems Analyst II, Remote Position
description:
***Note for Current UM Employees***
-----------------------------------

**Current employees must apply internally via connectU >** connectu.olemiss.edu

**Definition of Class**
-----------------------


The University of Mississippi (UM) Graduate School invites applications and nominations for the position of Systems Analyst II. This is a work-from-home, fully-remote position.

  

This position analyzes, designs, implements and coordinates the development, selection, and installation of new computerized software, hardware, and communication systems; and assists in providing computer design and support for the particular office or offices that the current project is being designed. The incumbent provides computer design and applications development expertise for the existing project.

**Examples of Work Performed**
------------------------------

* Performs problem analysis and specification studies to determine the benefits and costs of installation or conversion to computerized systems.
* Designs and implements computerized systems that address the identified problems.
* Insures that the proposed system has conceptual integrity, clear interface definition, modularity and clarity.
* Investigates, recommends, installs and supports software and hardware computer products with regard to their suitability for addressing computer needs.
* Develops appropriate documentation and specifications to support the requirements of the computerized systems.
* Configures enterprise applications to meet the needs of campus users. Confers with users to determine needs, processes, and project requirements.
* Conducts in-house training programs for staff development and user training sessions. Develops user manual and documentation for designed systems.
* Builds database on server/workstations. Performance tunes database for optimum use. Establishes queries and views for database access.
* Maintains software application.
* May instruct and supervise the assignments of the Systems Analyst I.
* Reads professional journals, participates in classes and workshops, networks with peers, and accesses knowledge bases to keep up with current software application development techniques and methodologies.
* Acts as a liaison to academic and non-academic departments.
* Performs similar or related duties as assigned or required.
**Essential Functions**
-----------------------


These essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following. Additional essential functions may be identified and included by the hiring department.

* Analyzes, designs, and coordinates the development, selection and installation of new computerized software, hardware and communications systems.
* Provides technical direction, conducts in-house training programs, develops user manuals and documentation, and conducts user-training sessions.
* Defines and maintains users, applications and devices on the network.
* Installs network software and related upgrades, maintain applications and trains users for application use.
* Establishes database design based on data relationships, builds database on server/workstations and performance tunes database for optimum use.
**Position Details**
--------------------


The University of Mississippi (UM) Graduate School invites applications and nominations for the position of Systems Analyst II. This is a work-from-home, fully-remote position.

  

The incumbent provides support and implementation expertise for the Graduate School’s use of customer relations management software (SalesForce) for efficient communication for graduate student recruitment. This is a non-supervisory position in which the incumbent analyzes, designs, implements and coordinates the development, selection, and installation of new computer software, hardware, and communication systems and assists in providing computer design and support for the Graduate School.

  

The position reports to the associate dean of the Graduate School, Prof. Robert Doerksen (rjd@olemiss.edu), who is the hiring manager for this search. Feel free to check with him if you have any questions or if you wish to nominate someone for this position.

**Minimum Education/Experience**
--------------------------------


Education:  

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited four-year college or university in management information systems, computer science or a related field.

  

AND

  

Experience:  

Two (2) years of experience related to the above described duties.

  

Substitution Statement:  

Related experience may be substituted for education, on a basis set forth and approved by the Department of Human Resources.

**Application Procedures**
--------------------------


Review of applications will begin immediately and continue till the position is filled. Applications, including resume and cover letter, should be submitted through https://careers.olemiss.edu, preferably by March 29, 2024.

**Salary/Wage Information**
---------------------------


To learn more about our pay structure and view our salary ranges, click here to visit the Compensation page of our Human Resources website. This link is provided for general pay information. Hourly rate or salary may vary depending on qualifications, experience, and departmental budget. Note: Unclassified positions (faculty, executives, researchers and coaches) do not have established salary ranges.**EEO Statement**
-----------------


The University of Mississippi provides equal opportunity in any employment practice, education program, or education activity to all qualified persons. The University complies with all applicable laws regarding equal opportunity and affirmative action and does not unlawfully discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based upon race, color, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, citizenship, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or genetic information.

  

Interview Requirements: Any candidate who is called for an interview must notify the Department of Equal Opportunity/Regulatory Compliance in writing of any reasonable accommodation needed prior to the date of the interview.

**Background Check Statement**
------------------------------


The University of Mississippi is committed to providing a safe campus community. UM conducts background investigations for applicants being considered for employment. Background investigations include a criminal history record check, and when appropriate, a financial (credit) report or driving history check.

title: Senior Business Systems & Legal Requirements Analyst (Corporate Position)
description:
**Position Description:**

The Senior Business Systems Analyst plays a crucial role in the with our VA customer by bridging the gap between legal requirements and technological solutions. This position requires a deep understanding of legal processes, regulations, and the VA operations, along with expertise in business analysis. The Senior Business Systems Analyst collaborates with legal stakeholders, IT teams, and subject matter experts to analyze legal requirements, identify technology solutions, and ensure that systems align with the VA's strategic goals.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Legal Requirements Analysis: Conduct comprehensive analysis of legal processes, procedures, and regulations within the BVA. Collaborate with legal stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, concise, and unambiguous business and functional requirements.
* Technology Solution Identification: Work closely with IT teams and subject matter experts to identify suitable technology solutions that meet the legal requirements of the BVA. Evaluate existing systems, propose enhancements, and recommend new technologies to support the legal operations effectively.
* Business Process Analysis: Analyze and document existing legal processes within the BVA, identifying areas for improvement, streamlining, and automation. Collaborate with stakeholders to define and document optimized and efficient legal workflows.
* Requirements Documentation: Create detailed requirement specifications, including use cases, process flows, data models, and other relevant artifacts. Ensure that legal requirements are clearly documented and communicated to both legal and technical stakeholders.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate closely with legal stakeholders, IT teams, and subject matter experts to facilitate effective communication and ensure alignment between legal requirements and technology solutions. Serve as a point of contact for legal-related discussions and provide guidance on best practices.
* Change Management: Manage changes to legal requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Conduct impact analysis, communicate changes to stakeholders, and ensure proper documentation and traceability of requirements.
* Quality Assurance: Participate in quality assurance activities, including reviewing test plans, test cases, and test results to ensure that developed solutions meet the specified legal requirements. Identify and address any gaps or inconsistencies in the requirements throughout the development lifecycle.
* Subject Matter Expertise: Maintain a deep understanding of legal processes, regulations, and policies within the BVA. Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies related to legal operations and business analysis.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Legal Operations Analyst, or similar role within the context of the Veteran disability appeals process.
* In-depth knowledge of legal processes, regulations, and policies related to the BVA's operations is required.
* Strong understanding of business analysis techniques, methodologies, and tools.
* Familiarity with software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies and their application to legal requirements analysis is required.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with legal and technical stakeholders.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality deliverables.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Understanding of veterans' benefits and the appeals process is required.

We apply knowledge, project, and life-cycle management best practices to catalyze change.
