title: IT Business Analyst
description:
**Who You Are**
---------------



You are devoted, compassionate, and enjoy being on the front lines in healthcare, changing the lives of your patients. You are passionate about getting to the root cause of a patient's conditions, removing social determinants of healthcare, and ensuring the highest possible quality of life for those in your care. You don't want to sacrifice quality over quantity, and you aim to provide the same level of care and commitment to your patients that you would to your own family member.


**Does this sound like you?** **If so, we should talk.**

  


**Who We Are**
--------------



We are Honest Medical Group, a groundbreaking team of health care professionals focused on making a major impact in health care. At Honest, we align every aspect of our company to support patients and providers. We are **devoted to purpose** and **inspired by innovation**. We **embrace our communities** and **lead with kindness**. We drive health improvements, create a seamless member experience, and eliminate unnecessary cost. We listen to the needs of our patients and our employees—continually working to push beyond the status quo.


**For us, it's all in an Honest day's work.**

  



**Your Role**
-------------



The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for fostering collaboration across cross-functional teams to pinpoint business requirements, craft effective solutions, and ensure the seamless integration of technology in our healthcare environment. Central to these responsibilities is the production of high-quality documentation artifacts, aimed at ensuring we have a shared understanding of business requirements and proposed technology solutions as we work through the complete design and delivery lifecycle. The IT Business Analyst will also play a key role in optimizing and streamlining healthcare business systems process by leveraging their expertise in system analysis and implementation.


**Primary Functions Include:**
------------------------------


* Act as a liaison between technology and business end-users, working with them to document current workflow processes.
* Collaborate with users to identify, define, and document business rules, process improvement options and alternatives as directed by business needs.
* Translate, simplify, and analyze the feasibility of requirements to enhance business processes and promote efficient solution design.
* Transform conceptual user needs into clear, functional business requirements for development teams.
* Assist in the formulation of business cases, identify required information fields and assist in the development of a data dictionary.
* Collaborate with systems and data services teams to ensure solutions align with business strategies and capability requirements.
* Consult with customers to develop process flows reflecting business process requirements.
* Manage requirements and issues using tools like JIRA.
* Verify that solutions align with specified requirements.
* Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders.
* Formulate, document, and verify user stories, acceptance criteria, process flows, and mockups.
* Assist in the design of testing strategies for the implementation of information systems, modules, and subsystems.
* Conduct System Impact Analysis with a focus on both current and proposed states.
* Assist in the development of the technology roadmap, helping align business requirements with system capabilities and data needs.
* Build comprehensive business requirement documents where necessary.
* Effectively communicate complex and/or difficult information to both technical and non-technical audiences in written and oral form
* Perform other related responsibilities as assigned.

  


**How You Qualify**
-------------------



You reviewed the Who You Are section of this job posting and immediately felt the need to read on. This makes you a match for our innovative culture. You accept things change quickly in a startup environment and are willing to pivot quickly on priorities.


* Must have reliable access to high-speed internet to ensure seamless remote work communication and productivity
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field or 4+ years of experience in IT business analysis.
* 3+ years of hands-on IT experience, encompassing all major phases of software implementation projects, including business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and prioritization within healthcare environments
* 1+ year(s) of experience in Agile Methodology, demonstrating adaptability to dynamic project environments.
* Experience with EMRs, CRM platforms, Tableau or other data and analytics tools preferred
* Proficient in Agile tools, with a preference for experience in Jira.
* Strong understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

**How You are Supported**
-------------------------


* As a full-time team member, you will benefit from Honest's exceptional total rewards package, including competitive base pay with bonuses, paid time off starting at 4 weeks for full time employees, 12 paid holidays per year, reimbursement for continuing medical education, 401k with match, health, dental, and vision insurance.
* As a part-time team member, *y*ou will benefit from Honest's total rewards package, including competitive base pay with bonuses, pro-rated paid time off, paid holidays, reimbursement for continuing medical education, 401k with match.
* Family friendly policies that support paid parental leave and flexible work arrangements
* As a team member you'll be supported by our robust commitment to training and development that starts with onboarding and continues throughout your career with Honest
* You will collaborate with like-minded healthcare professionals who, like you, understand the importance and value of Honest's high-quality, value-based, care model.


Honest is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.



Honest is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should email talent@HonestMedicalGroup.com for assistance. Reasonable accommodation will be determined on a case-by-case basis.

title: Finance Systems Analyst
description:
**About the team & opportunity**
--------------------------------



What's so great about working on Calendly's Operations team?



We are the infrastructure of our business that allows us to scale to new heights.



Why do we need you? Well, we are looking for a Finance Systems Analyst who will bring a thorough understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), internal controls and possess a passion for process optimization & automations. You will report to the Head of IT and will be responsible for working closely alongside the FinOps department and technical resources to support the design, testing, and deployment of system improvements, as well as lead the day-to-day administration of the FinOps tech stack.


**A day in the life of a Finance Systems Analyst at Calendly**
--------------------------------------------------------------



Using your deep understanding of financial systems and a track record of crafting creative, high-quality solutions, you will proactively partner across the company to ensure FinOps systems operate effectively. You will serve as a bridge between our functional and technical business partners.


**On a typical day, you will be working on:**
---------------------------------------------


* Support the technical configuration, development, maintenance, and day-to-day administration of third-party applications
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders, translating their business needs into systems-leveraged solutions
* Help create detailed flowcharts, process documentation, and end-user training materials
* Participate in the optimization of processes to improve efficiencies and reduce manual effort
* Maintain reliable change management practices and documentation
* Monitor integrations to identify and resolve sync issues, either independently or in partnership with third-party support teams
* Own with the implementation of new applications that we elect to bring into our Finance tech stack

**What do we need from you?**
-----------------------------


* 3+ years of experience providing technical support to Finance teams with an understanding of accounting concepts, GAAP, internal controls, and financial reporting
* 2+ years of experience owning the administration and optimization of NetSuite (end-to-end implementation experience is a plus!)
* Previous experience re-engineering the Source-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash, and Record-to-Report core business processes in the SaaS space
* Hands-on experience with NetSuite, Workday Adaptive Planning, Chargebee, Zip, Avalara, Workato, or Navan highly preferred
* Accounting or Finance background
* 1+ years of experience interacting with JSON/XML data structures, REST APIs, and SOAP APIs (Preferred)
* 1+ years of experience in a project management role supporting waterfall and agile methodologies (Preferred)
* Authorized to work lawfully in the United States of America as Calendly does not engage in immigration sponsorship at this time

**What's in it for you?**
-------------------------



Ready to make a serious impact? Millions of people already rely on Calendly's products, and we're still in the midst of our growth curve — it's a fantastic time to join us. Everything you'll work on here will accelerate your career to the next level. If you want to learn, grow, and do the best work of your life alongside the best people you've ever worked with, then we hope you'll consider allowing Calendly to be a part of your professional journey.


**Our Hiring Process:**
-----------------------



We aim to provide an inclusive and equitable candidate experience to everyone who expresses interest in working at Calendly. To learn more about our hiring process, please visit our careers page at www.careers.calendly.com.



Once selected for an opportunity, the recruiter assigned to the role will keep you informed every step of the way. Have questions? Let your recruiter know! Want to share your experience? We are passionately committed to improving and building on our process, and we consider feedback a gift.


***If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the application or recruiting process, please contact us at recruiting@calendly.com .***


***Calendly is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If you are located in Hawaii, Montana, New Mexico, North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Iowa, West Virginia, and Rhode Island, you will not be eligible for employment. Note that all individual roles will specify location eligibility.***


***All candidates can find our Candidate Privacy Statement*** ***here***


***Candidates residing in California may visit our Notice at Collection for California Candidates here:*** ***Notice at Collection***



Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to location, experience, and job-related skills. In addition, Calendly offers a wide range of best in class **total rewards**. This includes comprehensive employee benefits like healthcare, dental, vision, parental leave, 401(k) match, paid time off, and much more. At Calendly we believe exceptional performance deserves exceptional rewards! During the hiring process, we are committed to sharing details about the compensation range for the position, enabling you to make an informed decision.



Please note that the compensation details listed in role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus/commission, equity, or benefits.

 **Base Pay Range National - Salary**


$86,700—$117,300 USD**Base Pay Range California - Salary**


$106,250—$143,750 USD

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Emergent Talent, a division of Emergent Method, is seeking entry-to-junior level candidates to fill multiple analyst positions on a large-scale IT system implementation project. The selected individuals will work in multiple phases of the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), from requirements gathering to deployment and warranty.


This is a full-time position that will support ongoing project operations in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. **Remote candidates will be considered and are encouraged to apply.**


The ideal candidate is flexible, able to work in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment, confident handling a wide range of tasks and utilizing problem-solving skills, and willing to embrace the challenges associated with complex system implementation projects. Additionally, candidates should have relevant technical backgrounds and experience with exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.


Key responsibilities include:


* Engaging directly with client stakeholders to define business priorities and develop comprehensive requirements and functional designs, including working with the team to draft materials and conduct these sessions
* Serving as a front-line point of contact to work with the India-based delivery team to build and test functionality based on the agreed-upon client design
* Working through the testing phase including writing and executing test cases
* Supporting the clients during user acceptance testing, including writing test cases, tracking progress, and triaging defects
* Working alongside the onshore technical team to manage the deployments from start to finish
* Collaborating with clients to define requirements and create the product backlog
* Acting as the liaison between multiple teams to accomplish goals, including design, offshore development, testing, cross-functional teams, and the product owner
* Supporting the Scrum Master in completing and facilitating sprint ceremonies
* Performing integration testing and support the system testing and user acceptance testing teams
* Collaborating effectively with project team members
* Providing regular support throughout the day for testing, as well as consistent status updates
* Utilizing strong communication skills to present and communicate data, trends, insights, and recommendations


QUALIFICATIONS
===============


Ideal candidates should possess the following knowledge, skills, and abilities:


* A bachelor’s degree in computer science, information sciences, management information systems, or a related technical field is preferred (experience that demonstrates commensurate experience will be considered in lieu of a degree)
* Familiarity with and understanding of best practices related to SDLC methodologies, including Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, Iterative, and other project lifecycles
* Knowledge of change management processes and procedures specific to handling of change requests
* Experience with MS Project, HP PPM skills, MS Excel, and MS PowerPoint
* Experience in at least one programming language (e.g., SQL, HTML, JAVA, PHP)
* Knowledge of creating technical and architecture diagrams
* Experience with Jira or similar tools
* Strong analytical, problem solving, and interpersonal skills
* Quick learner with the ability to pivot swiftly based on changing direction
* Ability to multitask and juggle multiple requests and competing priorities
* Self-motivated and deadline-oriented to ensure tasks are completed without supervision
* Ability to be a team player, foster a cooperative environment with the project team, and adapt to the team

Preferred qualifications:

* Familiarity with Health and Human Services policies and mandates
* Experience with integrated eligibility systems and enterprise applications
* SDLC experience
* Experience in requirements gathering
* Experience in client-facing roles and supporting client needs
* Technical project experience
* Experience in Agile development methodologies


BACKGROUND
===========


Emergent Method is a Louisiana-based management consulting firm focused on helping companies and organizations innovate, grow, improve their performance, and achieve their missions.


We do this by bringing people and ideas together to understand opportunities, let ideas emerge, and create multi-faceted solutions with results greater than the sum of their parts. We come from diverse backgrounds that lend to expertise in solving complex problems, implementing impactful change, helping our clients navigate shifting landscapes, and seizing opportunities – including those they had not seen before. From strategic planning and organizational design to project management and strategic communication, we are dedicated to helping our clients adapt, innovate, and grow – pushing systems, agencies, and industries to new heights, while developing strategic, systemic solutions and processes to support those goals.


We opened our doors in 2012 and have been recognized for growth and achievement over the years, including the Greater Baton Rouge Business Report and Junior Achievement's Company of the Year (2017), Consulting Magazine’s fastest growing consulting firms (2018, 2019, 2020, 2022), Inc. Magazine’s fastest-growing private companies in America (2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022), LSU’s 100 fastest growing alumni-owned businesses (2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022), and the Louisiana Association of Business and Industry’s Company of the Year (2019).


We are dedicated to seeking the same measures of continuous improvement for the clients we serve and supporting them in all actions of planning, growth, and emergence to the forefront of their industries.


To learn more about Emergent Method and our team, visit our website at emergentmethod.com. To learn more about Emergent Method and our team, visit our website at emergentmethod.com.

*Emergent Method and associated entities are equal opportunity employers. We do not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis or any protected class under federal, state, or local law.*

title: Timekeeping Business Systems Analyst
description:
FIN Controllers Office

Full Time

74762BR

Job Summary

The Timekeeping Business Systems Analyst applies skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of time and attendance systems, industry-wide business process and analysis practices and organizational policies and procedures, timekeeping and payroll business processes, and analytical practices. The Timekeeping Business Systems Analyst is responsible for resolving a wide range of complex functional and technical issues in support of UCSF’s HBS Time and Attendance system. The Timekeeping Business Systems Analyst functions as the primary HBS data analyst, requirements analyst, and quality assurance analyst for new system enhancements and upgrades for HBS and for UCPath enhancements and upgrades that are related to timekeeping and absence management. The Timekeeping Business Systems Analyst resolves a wide range of business process issues of moderate to complex scope. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions.

Under the general direction of the UCPath and HBS Systems Manager/Project Manager, the Timekeeping Business Systems Analyst position is a key role in the Systems Unit of the UCSF Controller’s Office Payroll Services Department. This position is the primary analyst who provides support to ensure the successful implementation of changes to and the effective maintenance of the HBS Time and Attendance System. This position supports the day-to-day operational needs of the HBS Processing Center and the Payroll Services Department.

Department Description

**Vision:**  
To be trusted leaders providing exceptional payroll solutions and respectful customer care.

**Mission:**  
To provide customers best-in-class payroll solutions through UC systemwide advocacy, optimized system integration, empathetic customer support, and seamless business processes.

The mission of the UCSF Controller’s organization is to deliver full accounting services and related systems for faculty, staff, and students, UCSF Foundation, all University departments, and any outside entities who have a business relationship with the University. Services provided include General Ledger, Capital and Cash Accounting, Payroll, Student Loan Billing and Collections, Contracts and Grants Accounting, and Foundation Accounting. The Office uses sophisticated technology to account for and report on UCSF's financial activity.

Payroll is a major unit of the Controller’s Office. The Controller’s office utilizes various systems to collect, disburse, and report on funds. The payroll unit provides payroll collection and management for approximately 300 departments, as well as time and attendance and pay processing, systems management, project management, and accounting services. The primary functions include the facilitation of timely payments to approximately 30,000 employees per month.

The HBS Processing Center is responsible for collecting time information for the UCSF community and for generating payroll files for UCPath to ensure that employees are paid timely and accurately in compliance with FLSA requirements, collective bargaining agreements, and University policies and practices. The HBS Processing Center is also responsible for tracking leave usage and maintaining leave balances for the UCSF community.

The Systems Unit within Payroll is responsible for supporting business processes, technical changes, and maintenance of the UCSF HBS time and attendance system and the UCPath system as it relates to absence management.

Required Qualifications

* BA or BS degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, IT or other related field and 3+ years of directly related experience; and/or equivalent combination of experience/training.
* 3-5 years of experience in systems analysis
* Proficiency in BRIO, SQL, or similar query tools for ad hoc reporting, analysis, and data issue resolution
* Broad knowledge relating to software design and the software development life cycle (SDLC)
* Full working knowledge of MS Suite (Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Visio), SmartSheet
* Demonstrated functional and technical knowledge of timekeeping/time and attendance systems
* Ability to provide sophisticated functional systems analysis within the payroll, absence management, and timekeeping system domains
* Critical, systems thinker able to track interconnected processes and data flow and to develop and document functional systems requirements
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to synthesize findings and develop alternative solutions
* Thorough knowledge of business and process analysis functions.
* Thorough Knowledge of related areas of IT.
* Strong skills and knowledge of methodologies associated with the analysis of processes and problems, information flow, and architecture.
* In-depth understanding and skill in process and systems requirement documentation standards, such as Use Case modeling, User Story creations, and narrative description.
* Demonstrate a proactive approach to identifying opportunities and must have exemplary follow-up and follow through to prompt resolution of identified issues and risks and follow-up and follow through of various documentations
* Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.
* Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines. Demonstrates problem-solving skills.
* Thorough knowledge of business processes and procedures.
* Demonstrated testing and test planning skills.
* Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization. Interpersonal and communication skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization.
* Quantitative and Analytical skills
* Detail and quality orientation
* Ability to work effectively in a deadline-driven environment

Preferred Qualifications

* Graduate degree MBA/MPA
* PMP Certification
* CPP Certification
* Knowledge or University accounting, financial, and HR policies
* Knowledge of project management methods, and the ability to coordinate moderately complex systems projects.
* Experience with payroll or HRIS systems and business processes
* Experience with PeopleSoft HCM, payroll, and GL modules and configurations
* Familiarity with Lean principles, tools, and methodologies

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 4 years
* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Remote: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Unlock the door to operational excellence as a Business Systems Analyst! Join us on a mission to enhance service levels and operational efficiencies through innovative processes and technology changes. As a key player supporting the Assistant Vice President of Operations Support, you'll become a subject matter expert, driving impactful change in system functions. Bring your expertise to the table, collaborating with executives, managing system and process changes, and ensuring seamless daily operations. If you're a tech-savvy professional with a growth mindset and a passion for efficiency, this is your opportunity to make a difference!


Input 1 is a dynamic organization that operates in a rapidly changing environment. The responsibilities associated with the position may change in accordance with the company’s business needs. More specifically, the employee may be required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those set forth below.


**$80,000/year - $100,000/year (bi-weekly pay).**


**Position Purpose**


The goal of this position is to assist the Assistant Vice President, Operations Support in identifying, planning and executing plans to improve service levels and operational efficiencies via process or technology change, resolve ad hoc system operational issues, design solutions and produce system, procedural and related documentation and artifacts.


**Essential Job Functions**


* Become a business systems subject matter expert by understanding and staying well-informed of operational procedures and business use-cases for system functions


* Continuously search for and identify opportunities for improvement in efficiencies and/or cost reductions via process or technology change


* Consult or collaborate with executives and managers to develop, implement and manage system and process change throughout operations


* Participate in pre-deployment testing and post-deployment implementation and monitoring of newly developed system features


* Document current and new system processes and workflows


* Support daily operations by resolving timely, accurately, efficiently and completely day-to-day operational system and data issues


* Support new client implementation process and knowledge management activities by creating and revising effective systems and procedural documentation and artifacts


Position Description Title: Business Systems Analyst Reports to: Assistant Vice President, Operations Support


**Qualifications and Skills**


To be successful in this position, the individual must be able to perform each essential function. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required for this position.


**Education and Experience**


* 4-year college degree preferred


* PMP certification preferred


* Basic knowledge of SQL and ability to work in low code environment


* At least 5 years of previous similar work experience in IT, project management, or other related fields preferred


**Competencies**


**Universal:**


* Effective Communication
* Customer Orientation
* Building Collaborative Relationships
* Personal Credibility
* Technical Expertise

**Role Competencies:**


* Persuasive Communication
* Strong Analytical Thinking
* Diagnostic Information Gathering
* Growth Mindset
* Curiosity
* Initiative
* Fostering Innovation
* Managing Change
* Results Orientation
* Self Confidence

**$80,000/year - $100,000/year (bi-weekly pay).**

title: System Analyst
description:
**Overview:**


* We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented System Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a System Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes for our clients. This role requires a deep understanding of business processes, business data, excellent analytical skills, and a thorough understanding of IT development processes (Agile) and tools (databases, programming languages).


**Responsibilities:**


**Requirement Analysis:**


* Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for business processes.
* Translate business requirements into technical specifications for developers.


**Technical Analysis:**


* Be able to triage and diagnose technical issues in code and data. Be able to formulate high-level approaches to design issues and recommend business architecture solutions to clients and developers.

**Testing and Quality Assurance:**


* Support testing of solutions to ensure functionality and performance meet business requirements.
* Collaborate with quality assurance teams to address and resolve any issues identified during testing.


**Documentation:**


* Create comprehensive documentation for solutions, including technical specifications, test plans, and user guides.
* Maintain documentation to ensure accuracy and relevance.


**Collaboration:**


* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, developers, and project managers, to ensure successful delivery of solutions.
* Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience in corporate IT solution development and implementation.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Strong familiarity with Agile development methodologies.


**Preferred Skills:**


* Familiarity with database systems and SQL.
* Basic understanding of modern programming concepts and languages
* Experience with US Health Care Payor systems implementations


**Benefits:**


* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Positive and collaborative work environment.


If you are passionate about leveraging technology to streamline business processes and drive efficiency, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a System Analyst. Join us in shaping the future of business automation and data management with innovative solutions.


**About 10Pearls:**



10Pearls is a global, purpose-driven digital technology partner helping our clients re-imagine, digitalize ‎, and accelerate their businesses. As an end-to-end digital partner, 10Pearls helps businesses create transformative ‎digital products incorporating emerging technologies and utilizing our broad expertise in ‎product management, UI/UX, cloud architecture, software development, data science, cybersecurity, and quality assurance. 10Pearls' clients include Global 2000 enterprises, high-growth mid-size ‎businesses, and exciting start-ups across several industries, including healthcare, financial services, ‎energy, education, real estate, and retail. ‎Headquartered in the Washington DC metro area, 10Pearls has a far-reaching global presence with delivery centers in North America, Latin America, Europe, and South Asia.



The ‎Washington Post has referred to 10Pearls as a double-bottom-line company that balances profits with our responsibility to our communities. Recognized on the Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Companies List for the last four years and awarded the #1 Most Diverse Midsize Company in Greater Washington by the Washington Business Journal, we leverage the passions and intelligence of our people to ensure we deliver solutions ‎that meet and exceed our clients' needs.



We are growing rapidly and looking for talented people to join our team. If you are seeking an opportunity to make an impact with an innovative company, we would love to meet you!


**We offer a competitive compensation package, including the below benefits for full-time employees:**


* Strong medical, dental, and vision plans with 60% of premiums for employees and their dependents covered by 10Pearls
* Employer-funded health reimbursement account (HRA) for the high deductible health plan option
* Generous 401(k) plan with a 4% employer match and immediate vesting after 90 days of employment
* Flexible paid time off for vacation, sick/wellness, and personal leave; separate paid parental leave program
* Employer-paid short-term, long-term, life, and AD&D insurance
* Additional voluntary insurance programs, including life & AD&D, critical illness, cancer, and hospital indemnity for employees and dependents
* Full access to Tysons Corner Headquarters office with amenities: a state-of-the-art gym, a fully stocked kitchen with snacks and cold brew coffee on tap, and free parking on-site.


*10Pearls is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to maintaining a diverse workplace.*

title: Business Systems Analyst Associate
description:
**Job Overview:**


Graham Technologies (GTECH) seeks a Business Analyst, to assists in formulating and defining systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with a basic understanding of business systems and industry requirements. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, and revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary under direction of experienced Business System Analysts. Competent to consider most business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.

**You will be happy to know that this a remote role with a preference for candidates based in Dayton, OH or the DC area. Occasional travel may be required for team meetings and training. The role requires collaboration with teams across different departments and locations.**

**Responsibilities:**

* Analyze business processes and requirements, identifying opportunities for improvement.
* Translate business needs into system requirements, working closely with the Appian development team to ensure they understand and can meet these requirements.
* Assist in the application development and rationalization process, ensuring optimal configuration and use of Appian application.
* Collaborate with refactoring and modernization teams to ensure Appian applications are up to date and efficient.
* Understand legacy systems such as SAMIS and CMCS, and ensure that their capabilities and constraints are factored into Appian application development.
* Ensure information assurance and quality assurance in all Appian application.

**Competencies:**

* Strong knowledge of business process analysis, application development, and system administration.
* Familiarity with Appian software and its application within a business context.
* Understanding of legacy systems such as SAMIS and CMCS- - NATURAL, COBOL, ADABAS, FOCUS.
* Experience with refactoring and modernization efforts.
* Ability to work in a cross-functional team.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years consulting and/or directly relevant industry experience. • AA or 2yr Tech School w/2+ years
* US citizen with the ability to pass a government background check.
* Proven experience as a business analyst, specifically within Appian development.
* Experience with refactoring and modernization efforts.
* Knowledge of and experience with legacy systems such as SAMIS and CMCS - - NATURAL, COBOL, ADABAS, FOCUS.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master's degree in a relevant field

**Compensation:**


At GTech, we believe in treating every person the way we want to be treated - fairly. Our compensation package ensures everyone at GTech is given equal pay for equal work - regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, age, nationality, or even negotiation skills!


Most IT companies can probably offer many of the same services, but what sets us apart from the others is truly our people! We care about our employees and show it often with sincere appreciation and acknowledgment of not only the final work products but also the little steps taken along the way! In addition, our generous benefits package helps support our team members in living well and prospering.


Here are just a few highlights:

* Four Week's Accrued PTO First Year
* Ten Paid Federal Holidays
* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* 401(k) Plan with Annual Employer Contributions
* Flexible Schedules
* Reimbursements for Continued Education and Training

**Why Graham Technologies?**


Our Core Values say it all!

* Value our Customers
* Care about our Employees
* Passionate about Innovation
* Believe in a Strong Work Ethic
* Rely on Teamwork
* Integrity Matters


Founded in 2007, GTech is a consulting services firm zealous about providing the best solutions to address our client's needs and maximize the value of their investments. One of the ways we do this is by providing exceptional employees for our clients - whose range of expertise expands the entire IT industry! We've cultivated a family of individuals where integrity, commitment, and reliability are etched into the heart of our delivery teams.


In addition, we are equally zealous about caring for our employees - the lifeblood of our business! We've purposefully created a culture that is friendly, family-oriented, and all-inclusive. Our team members are encouraged to "have a life," both in and out of the office, through flexible schedules (where available), continuing education, and support to pursue their passions!

title: Associate Applications Systems Analyst

title: Computer Systems Analyst(With Public trust or Any Federal government Clearance)
description:
**Job Title:** Computer Systems Analyst(With Public trust or Any Federal government Clarence)
**Location:** US-Remote
Computer Systems Analyst
Analyse science, engineering, business, and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems. Analyse user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations. May analyse or recommend commercially available software. The candidate must be willing to work with third party code vendors and maintaining customized systems. Work experience should be 0-2 years.
Additional Information:
* Ability to solicit and understand business requirements and convert them into technical requirements. The ability to comprehend a business need and translate it into specific if/then programmable language.
* Ability to track down answers from the IRS and/or Leidos architects. When a question arises, they’ll need to take initiative to find an answer. They’ll need to be able to communicate with IRS folks and Leidos leadership for some answers.
* The patience and focus to read through hundreds or thousands of requirements per document type.
* The ability to understand complex if/then logic, and spot logical errors and opportunities for enhanced clarity.
* The ability to understand AI/ML concepts like model training and training sets vs testing sets, and garbage in garbage out, etc.
* The skills to understanding the complex business requirements of the IRS and hunting down answers when questions arise.
* Please note that the candidate may begin working with code when the interim MBI approval is received.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Who We Are**


At Wondersign, we improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful, smart software. We love a good challenge, and we have fun achieving our goals.

  

**Job Description**


The Business Systems Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. Documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and creates system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This role functions as the liaison between IT and users, and requires both business and technical expertise.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support business strategies;
* Documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and creates system specifications that drive system development and implementation;
* Works with internal teams to obtain an in-depth understanding of the product and the documentation requirements;
* Produces high-quality documentation that meets applicable standards and is appropriate for its intended audience;
* Contributes to and maintains the information architecture;
* Participates in scrum ceremonies and actively contributes to SDLC;
* Researches information using available internal and external resources;
* Performs other related duties as assigned.


**Experience and Skill Requirements**


* Minimum of 5 years of related work experience as part of a Software Engineering team or as Technical Writer
* Ability to read and understand source code written in Python and/or JavaScript
* Familiarity with the SDLC and software development
* Experience with Agile/Scrum methodology
* Excellent written skills in English
* Excellent research skills - the ability to research technology, customer needs and industry trends
* Work well within a team environment and under pressure
* Possess high attention to detail
* Process driver with a “Get it done” attitude
* Proper phone and email etiquette
* Effective listening and customer service skills


**Here's How We Work**


***Offering Freedom & Flexibility.*** We're a distributed team working from around the globe, with core teams in Tampa, Florida and San Diego, California. We give our team members a high degree of workplace flexibility with many options for remote work. As a team, we take full ownership for our results.


***Tackling Exciting Challenges.*** The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. We come up with new ways brands and retailers can navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.


***Taking Ownership.*** We don't accept the status quo and we challenge ourselves, our processes, our services, and each other to deliver the best possible experience.


***Being Truthful & Inclusive.*** We are transparent in our decisions and our communication, and we value and respect feedback from any source, whether internal or external. We only win as a team, and we understand that everyone needs to stay involved, be empowered, and be held accountable.


**The Perks**


* Fully remote position
* Attractive compensation and PTO policy
* Company pays 100% of your medical, dental and vision insurance, 80% for your family
* Short and long term disability insurance (100% employer paid)
* Life insurance
* Company supports professional development for all team members
* Latest technology, equipment and software you need to do your job

  

**Other Duties**


Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


**Physical Demands/Work Environment**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

  

**Essential Physical & Mental Requirements**


* This position will require the following physical requirements; sitting (75%), walking (15%), standing (10%), lifting up to 10 pounds.
* This position will require the following mental requirements; Ability to reason through problems to reach solutions, troubleshooting ability, effective written and verbal communication skills and ability to see, type, speak on phone and work with various departments within the company.

  

**Additional Physical & Mental Requirements**


* This position will require the following mental requirements; while performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to high pressure to high-stress situations. Employee works in a typical office environment and is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical office equipment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Some travel to job sites and/or offices may be required. Must be able to travel and work an extended schedule as needed.


**Interested? Submit your resume and any supporting paperwork today! For more information, please visit www.wondersign.com (http://www.wondersign.com)**

title: Business Analyst
description:
Bond-Pro is seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join our growing Product Team.


**Who is Bond-Pro:**

  

Bond-Pro is a 25+ year old software company and the leader in providing enterprise software to insurance companies to manage their specialty line of Surety Bonds.

  

We are changing the industry and product management is essential to our mission.

  

Seeking experienced, passionate Product professionals.

  

**What is this Role:**

  

You will improve our product suite by translating market demands and clients' needs into new high-quality features. Your duties will include gathering, analyzing & defining the requirements, analyzing system requirements, addressing any relevant problems, performing standard testing, and chaperoning your assigned features throughout the SDLC to delivery.

  

BSA responsibilities are:

  

* Explore and evaluate current systems
* Define system requirements
* Interact with users to understand their needs and track additional requirements and features
* Work together with the development team to bring features to market
* Analyze changes by testing programs
* Support and train users on new system features, etc.
* Ensure deadlines and requirements are met
* Stay current on market and technical developments
* Become SME for assigned features/areas of the overall product suite


**Who is well suited for this Role?**

  

You should have experience with enterprise software web application development and integration. We seek creative and hardworking people who inspire those around them with their contributions to the team.

  

This position is open to candidates residing in FL, GA, IN, OH, PA, and TX.

  

BSA requirements are:

  

* 3+ years' experience working as a Business Systems Analyst
* Experienced in commercial software development, testing and documentation
* Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication skills – able to explain technical details to various audiences
* A bachelor's degree in a relevant area
* Experience in insurance or financial industry, preferably commercial surety bonds
* Understanding of using Azure DevOps or Jira to manage requirements in the Scrum process


This position will be fully remote. The core of the team is based in Tampa, Florida.

  

**Benefits**:

  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance


**About Bond-Pro**

  

Bond-Pro's fully integrated enterprise software suites enable Surety professionals with a full underwriting suite to evaluate and manage accounts as well as the tools to streamline and automate the entire life cycle of Surety Bonds.

  

Founded in 1991 and headquartered in Tampa, Florida, Bond-Pro is the leading software automation tool for Surety professionals. Our focus is developing state-of-the-art technology solutions to help surety carriers and agencies grow premiums, while reducing risks and operating costs. With 10 major releases and over 250,000 development hours, we dedicate 76% of our operating costs to the further enhancement of our products.

  

Bond-Pro is the most widely used surety automation software deployed by hundreds of agencies and dozens of national surety carriers. Bond-Pro leverages more than 20 years of customer feedback in developing surety software that provides the most feature rich functionality in the marketplace.

  

Learn more about us at www.bond-pro.com (https://www.bond-pro.com/)

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Business Systems Analyst**  

General Description

  

Seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst to join as a Business Systems Analyst. Responsible as the system data steward, ensuring alignment with business goals, and overseeing data ingestion, data governance, data quality, data reporting, data catalog, and data semantics.

  

Key Responsibilities

* Data Governance Product Ownership:
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into ETL system designs and data management strategies.
* Perform data analysis to identify data quality issues, anomalies, and inconsistencies, proposing and implementing solutions to enhance data accuracy and integrity.
* Support data governance initiatives, establishing policies, standards, and best practices for data management throughout the data lifecycle.
* Ensure continuous improvement and alignment with business goals.
* Data Integration and Transformation:
* Design, develop, and implement efficient data processes.
* Monitor the processes for collecting data and ensure that the information is in the right format
* Act as a Data Steward, Organize data according to the company's preferences
* Ensure data quality and consistency throughout the process.
* Help solve data-related issues by managing data corruption or mapping data between programs and systems
* Collaboration and Communication:
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including IT, data engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and alignment of ETL systems with business objectives.
* Provide expertise and support in troubleshooting ETL-related issues, optimizing performance, and enhancing system scalability
* Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements.
* Facilitate communication between technical and non-technical teams.
* Performance Monitoring and Optimization:
* Implement monitoring mechanisms for data process performance.
* Continuously optimize workflows for efficiency.
* Documentation:
* Maintain comprehensive documentation for data governance and ETL processes.
* Quality Assurance:
* Enforce best practices for data quality assurance.
* Conduct testing to validate data transformations.
* Other duties as assigned
  

Professional Qualities

* Flexible, organized, and detail-oriented with excellent critical thinking ability.
* Solid and practical understanding of technology (i.e., web-based applications, relational databases, etc.)
* Leadership qualities and Technical foundation
* Strong business sense and focus on customer value
* Understand business solutions and business requirements
* Economic thinking when making trade-off decisions
* Strategic planning abilities and Decisive attitude
* Strong negotiation and prioritization skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience with cloud-based ETL solutions.
* Knowledge of big data technologies.
* Understanding of data governance and security best practices.
  

Preferred Experience

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
* Proven experience as a Data Analyst with ETL focus.
* Proficient in ETL tools, SQL, and scripting languages.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills.
  

Physical Requirements

* Requires the ability to sit or stand for long periods of time, occasional stooping, and reaching; May require lifting up to 25 pounds; requires normal range of vision and hearing with or without accommodations.
  

Additional Information

* Clear Background Check Required.
  

Employment Information

* The position is remote but the main office is Located in North Charleston, SC.
* Benefits include health plan, dental, vision, and paid time off.
* Flex time.
* 401k with up to a 4% company match.

title: Pharmacy Systems Support Analyst-Remote[Mon–Fri 1 pm-9:30pm CST]
description:
**Job Title**: Pharmacy Systems Support Analyst **Job Summary**: ScriptPro is looking for a Pharmacy Systems Support Analyst to work Monday through Friday, 1 pm - 9:30pm. Responsibilities include troubleshooting, analyzing, and maintaining ScriptPro systems, applications, hardware, and computer peripherals, as well as using remote support software (i.e. BOMGAR, SecureLink, and Windows Remote Desktop) to assist customer with reported issues. This person will consult with customers to help identify recommended best practices for system configuration, pharmacy workflow, and potential enhancements available. **This is a remote work from home position regardless of location. Some travel may be required.**

**Remote Work Requirements:**

* Must have high-speed reliable internet access with a hard-wired connection
* Must have a distraction free home office workspace
* Must be willing to participate in video virtual meetings (camera on)
* Occasional travel is required

**Reporting Relationship**: Supervisor, Technical Support

**Shift**: Monday through Friday, 1 pm - 9:30pm. Regular and punctual attendance is an essential function of every job at ScriptPro.

**Scope of the Role:**

* Interact with customers to provide and process information in response to inquiries, concerns, and requests about products and services
* Conduct technical analysis and review of system performance
* Research required information using available resources including internal knowledge base articles, technical procedures, Sharepoint, mentors, and previously documented Service Requests
* Troubleshoot issues with proprietary software, third party insurance and credit card processing, Crystal and RDLC reports, mobile and web applications, Windows O/S, SQL database, and pharmacy operations workflow
* Deliver service and support to end-users through automated call distribution phone software and Oracle Service Cloud chat and email support simultaneously
* Respond to customer calls from a general issue queue or a subject matter expert specific queue as assigned
* Work a queue of tickets based on priority and impact to the customer
* Recommend workflow changes based on pharmacy needs and recommended best practices
* Organize ideas, updates, and resolutions in a manner appropriate to the intended audience and situation via oral and written communications
* Clearly communicate troubleshooting steps, ideas, workflow steps, and processes to end users
* Build customer relationships through providing superior customer service
* Document all job functions using Siebel with a high level of data quality
* Proactively monitor systems for performance and connectivity to minimize or eliminate downtime
* Perform other duties as assigned by a supervisor or manager

**Education and Experience Requirements:**

* Associates degree in a technology related field, or two years of equivalent related experience preferred
* Minimum of one year related Customer Service experience preferred
* Basic Windows OS knowledge (Windows7/10 Server 2012/2016)
* Working knowledge of desktop and peripheral hardware troubleshooting
* Basic understanding of connectivity and networking concepts
* Basic knowledge of SQL databases and query syntax required, intermediate knowledge preferred
* Experience with a remote support tool (BOMGAR, SecureLink, or Windows Remote Desktop, etc.)
* Experience with SLA driven resolution times
* Experience with a help desk ticketing system
* Demonstrate proficiency supporting proprietary software applications
* Pharmacy operations knowledge preferred


It is ScriptPro's policy to run a comprehensive background check post job offer and you must be able to obtain Department of Defense security clearance after date of hire. See Standard Form 86 to preview requirements.

**Attributes Desired:**

* Positive attitude, drive, and tenacity
* Ability to thrive in a position supporting a constantly evolving and growing industry
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to multitask with varying priorities, while still maintaining a high attention to detail
* Exemplary attendance and punctuality
* Outstanding customer service skills
* Problem solving and analytical skills

**Working Conditions:**


This position operates in an office environment. Routine use of standard office equipment is required. Must be able to use a computer for extended periods of time. Regularly required to sit, use hands and fingers, and expected to occasionally lift, stoop, bend, and reach. Ability to learn and solve practical problems and interpret a variety of instructions is required.

  

ScriptPro is not sponsoring any type of visa for this position.


ScriptPro is an Equal Opportunity Employer Committed to a Diverse and Inclusive Workforce.


Please visit www.scriptpro.com to learn more about the mission of our company.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
SalesIntel is the top revenue intelligence platform on the market. Their unique approach to data collection, enhancement, verification and growth distinguishes them from the market, solidifying their position as the best B2B data partner.  

  

As a Senior Salesforce Developer, you will be a key technical leader in the development of the SalesIntel Salesforce managed package offering. You will work closely with our broader Salesforce development team as well as the other product development teams to ensure that we have clean and reliable integrations. You will ensure that we are following best practices and that we create an exemplary App in the AppExchange. You will help refine SDLC, improve testing strategies and overall quality, and help to resolve tech debt to enable more rapid growth.  

  

**What You’ll Be Doing:**  

* Develop, test, and release the SalesIntel Managed package.
* Identify and set appropriate development standards and practices for Salesforce development.
* Identify and analyze issues, bugs, defects and other problems and take ownership to resolve or set paths to resolution.
* Become an expert in the SalesIntel<->Salesforce integration experience.
* Review stories and work in an Agile Scrum environment.
* Participate in code reviews and be a strong collaborator and contributor to overall package design.
* Lead Security Reviews and ensure that we are meeting all best practices.

**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
* 5-7 years of experience as a Salesforce Developer.
* Experience developing customer-facing interfaces.
* Advanced knowledge of Salesforce CRM platforms.
* Proficient in Apex, Javascript, LWC, and VisualForce.
* Good communication skills both written and verbal.
* Ability to problem solve high-level software and application issues.
* Ability to project manage.
* Proven experience with a Salesforce SDLC lifecycle.
* Experience with Git or other version control system.
* Experience with code reviews and providing feedback to teams.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work with product and project managers.
* Proven ability to think critically about problems and find solutions.
* Previous work experience developing Managed Packages or Integrating directly with other platforms and APIs.

  

This is a remote position.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**About This Job:**


Job Type: Full-time  

Salary: $75,000 - $110,000  

Experience Level: Mid Level  

Remote Details: Fully Remote, working Business Hours Central Time

**Why Choose Susco**


You'll benefit from having an influence on the technical direction of our projects, thoughtful career development, a healthy mix of management and development tasks, and transparency (no office politics). Our success lies in our amazing staff, which we have because of our people-centric culture (4.9/5.0 Employer Rating on Glassdoor).


Susco is headquartered in the Greater New Orleans Area, has a national remote workforce, and is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in the US (we are 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022 Inc 5000 honorees).


We’re fans of the American Dream, and therefore operate as a compassionate meritocracy which treats all stakeholders (employees, clients, vendors, and the community) based on tenants of conscious capitalism.


You can learn more about how our team feels about us by checking out employee testimonials here.

**Job Description:**


The BSA will serve as a liaison between business subject matter experts and the development team to assist in meeting corporate and compliance standards as well as serving a more technical role in designing and documenting systems.

**High Level Responsibilities:**

* They will be responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements and functional specifications, as well as supporting multiple Software Development projects.
* They will be responsible for creating Documentation for Existing un-Documented Systems, performing Data Analysis, Documenting Legacy Client Systems for Rebuild, and Designing Schema

**Detailed Responsibilities**

* Direct Report to the Director of Projects
* Scope
	+ Pre-Sale Discovery, Business Analysis, and Systems Analysis as an input to estimates and proposals
	+ Post-Sale Discovery, Business Analysis, and Systems Analysis as an input to project plans
* BA Duties
	+ Project Needs Analysis
	+ Discovery / Requirements Gathering
	+ Developing Conceptual Data Models
	+ Developing Project Charters
		- Stakeholder Goals
		- Success Metrics
		- Business Case
		- High Level Business Requirements
	+ Developing Functional Requirements
	+ Developing Wireframes
	+ Developing Test Plans for QA
	+ Developing Training & Support Documentation
* Systems Analysis Duties
* System Documentation
* Retrieving and analyzing data via SQL
* Analyzing legacy schema and documenting legacy domain
* Re-Designing legacy schema for to-be schema
* Entity Relationship Diagrams
* Schema Data Modeling
* Documenting existing systems from a business usage / domain aspect, technical writing
* Collaborate with external & internal stakeholder (not limited to)
	+ Executives
	+ Managers
	+ Non-Technical Personnel
	+ Developers
	+ Susco Vendors
	+ Client Vendors
* Misc. Technical Responsibilities
	+ Project Coordination
	+ QA Testing
	+ First-line customer support
	+ Data Analysis
	+ Report Writing (Crystal, SSRS or some other tool, preferred)

**Growth Opportunities – some short and long term**

* Project Manager
* Engagement Manager
* Sales Engineer

**Experience Requirements**

* 5+ years’ experience as a developer or BA or SA
* 3+ years of experience working in different phases of software development lifecycle, including application design and implementation experience
* 3+ years of experience writing system requirements
* 2+ years professional SQL

**Hard Skill Requirements**

* Requirements elicitation and documentation
* Technical writing
* Proficient in database schema design based on client requirements
* Proficient in SQL data analysis and reporting
* Proficient in managing databases with database provided IDEs (SSMS, pgAdmin, psql, etc)

**Nice-to-Have**

* Proficient in SQL Server Management Studio
* Proficient in SQL data migrations

**Soft Skill Requirements**

* Excellent Verbal and Communication Skills
* Active listening
* Dealing with conflict
* Quality client service techniques
* Decision making
* Problem solving
* Strategic thinking

**Perks**

* 18.5 days annual PTO, 7 Paid Holidays
* Heath, Life, Dental, & Vision Insurance, Long & Short Term Disability, 401(k)
* Company Leadership dedicated to personal & professional growth
* Any employee can refer a new client and get 5% of year one’s revenue, and 2.5% thereafter
* Quarterly bonuses based on company performance
* 3 days annual self-directed learning days
* Paid lunches several times per month
* Fully Remote work
* Ad-Hoc wellness based gifts, subsidized meditation training, subsidized gym membership
* Annual All-Hands Event and Bi-Annual Team Socials in New Orleans
* Virtual Friday Lunches

**About Us**

**Core Purpose**


To enable people to contribute in more fulfilling and meaningful ways.

**Mission**


To transform organizations with intuitive software. Our software frees people from tedious work, removes painful recurring costs, and allows organizations to control their own data, workflow, and user-experience.

**Core Values**

**Growth**: We believe we can create a better world by constantly growing as individuals, resulting in growth for the Company and growth for our clients.

**Communication:** We believe everyone deserves to feel like they have been heard and understood. We don’t complain about things under our control. We accept constructive criticism dispassionately.

**Action**: We believe we don't have good days, we make them. We believe in being proactive and not reactive. Passivity leads to a lack of involvement, while our focus is on creating the future. We don't complain, we identify and solve problems.

**Teamwork**: We believe that we are human beings first, coworkers second. We strive to be cognizant as people with lives outside of this office. As a high-performance organization, there are times of high stress. In those times, we rally to get the job done and we recognize our behavior and performance impacts our team.

**Efficiency**: We believe in learning from our mistakes the first time. We believe there is a time and place for complex solutions for complex problems. We also have the ability to decompose complex problems into simpler problems. When we see a problem or inefficiency, we have both the responsibility and the ability to propose solutions.
